title: Shanghai test vectors
body:
Follow chfast suggestion make a test vector file with test ID that is also referenced in the test itself 
A list of testID - test description in one file like changelog, and each test must mention corresponging ID in its info comment section 

- [x] check that Shanghai block rejected before transition (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1123)
- [x] check that Merge block rejected after transition (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1123)
- [x] check that Block without withdrawals root header field but with withdrawals in the body gets rejected after transition (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1123)
- [x] check that if withdrawals root does not match the withdrawals body block rejected (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x] check that Shanghai block without withdrawals rlp body is rejected as incomplete (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x] check what happens if withdrawals RLP body fields are in wrong order (equvivalent to testing the bounds)
- [x] check if withdrawals rlp body is not presented as List (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)

Withdrawals
```
      "index": "0x00",
      "validatorIndex", "0x00",
      "address": "0xabc...",
      "amount": "0x00...",
```
what a the ranges of this fields. check the bounds
- [x]  index is 2**64 (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  index experimental out of rlp bound for the fields (more than 2**256) (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  validatorIndex is 2**64  (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  validatorIndex experimental out of rlp bound for the fields (more than 2**256)  (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  address is less 20 bytes (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  address is more 20 bytes (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  address is bigint ((https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x] amount it 2**64 or high (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  amount is bigint (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [x]  amount is 0 (https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1124)
- [ ] what if there are two identical indexes in the block withdrawals list of items
- [ ] what if there are two identical validator indexes ? 
- [ ] can two different withdrawals happen to the same address? (equal or different validator index)
- [ ] withdrawal with 0x00 amouont. does not change anything?
- [ ] what if the fields in rlp comes mixed, wrong order? there order must be verified. 
- [ ] what if withdrawl happen to address, but in the same block smth happen to this addresss
1) it suicide 2) it gets fund from another transaction 3) it sends fund 4) it is being created or reverted

check that eth_getBlockBy  rpc requests report withdrawals in the block if they should

- [ ] check that if withdrawal happened to address A and in the same call a staticcall happened on A, the static call works fine
